lead_paragraph: To the Editor: The $51.5 million judgment against Philip Morris Companies by a California jury surely puts private lawsuits against big tobacco companies back on the front burner (front page, Feb. 12). However, instead of bogging down the courts and filling the pockets of lawyers, there is a much simpler solution to make those who profit pay.
abstract: Michael Lowery Tracy letter, commenting on February 12 article on $51.5 million judgment against Philip Morris Cos by California jury in private lawsuit, suggests that smokers should join free of charge private health care and disability plans of tobacco companies; says it is simpler solution to make those who profit from cigatettes pay and would avoid bogging courts down with suits

headline.main: Why Bog Down the Courts With Tobacco Suits?
